TextEquiv.Unicode: immortall, which before the resur
rection was mortall. So then this
body of ours in the resurrection shalbe
set free from all evill affections and
passions, from all corruption: but the
substance therof shall not bee brought
to naught, it shall not bee changed in
to a spirite, it shall not loose the own
and proper shape. And this body ve
rily because of that purification and
cleansing from those dregs, yea and ra
ther because of these heavenly and di
vine gifts, is called both a spirituall
body, and also a glorious and purified
body,
For Paul in the third to the Phi
lippians sayth: Our conversation is
in heaven, from whence we looke for
the saviour the Lord lesus Christ, who
shall chaunge our vile bodie that it
maie bee made like unto his glorious
body,
See heere, the Apostle calleth not
our resurrection from the dead, a
transubstantiation, or losse of the sub
staunce of our body, but a changing:
then also shewing what kinde of bo
dy that chaunged body is, hee calleth it
a glorious body, not without all shape,
and voyd of fashion, but augmented
in glory : yea he setteth before us the
very body of our Lord Jesus Christ,
wherein hee sheweth us what fashion
our bodies shall have beeyng in glory,
For in plaine words he faith: He shal
make our vile bodie like to his glori
ous body,
Let us therefore see what kind of
body our Lord had after his resurre
ction : it was neyther turned into
a ghost, nor brought to nothing, nor
yet not able to be known by the shape
and figure: For shewing them his
handes and feete, that were easily
knowne by the poynt of the nayles
wherewith hee was crucified, he said:

immortall, which before the resur rection was mortall. So then this body of ours in the resurrection shalbe set free from all evill affections and passions, from all corruption: but the substance therof shall not bee brought to naught, it shall not bee changed in to a spirite, it shall not loose the own and proper shape. And this body ve rily because of that purification and cleansing from those dregs, yea and ra ther because of these heavenly and di vine gifts, is called both a spirituall body, and also a glorious and purified body, For Paul in the third to the Phi lippians sayth: Our conversation is in heaven, from whence we looke for the saviour the Lord lesus Christ, who shall chaunge our vile bodie that it maie bee made like unto his glorious body, See heere, the Apostle calleth not our resurrection from the dead, a transubstantiation, or losse of the sub staunce of our body, but a changing: then also shewing what kinde of bo dy that chaunged body is, hee calleth it a glorious body, not without all shape, and voyd of fashion, but augmented in glory : yea he setteth before us the very body of our Lord Jesus Christ, wherein hee sheweth us what fashion our bodies shall have beeyng in glory, For in plaine words he faith: He shal make our vile bodie like to his glori ous body, Let us therefore see what kind of body our Lord had after his resurre ction : it was neyther turned into a ghost, nor brought to nothing, nor yet not able to be known by the shape and figure: For shewing them his handes and feete, that were easily knowne by the poynt of the nayles wherewith hee was crucified, he said:
Sce, for I ameven hee, to wit, cladde
againe with the same body wherein I
hung uppon the Crosse,
For speaking yet more plainely, d
prooving, that that bodie of his, was
not a spirituall substaunce, hee saide:
A spirite hath not fleshe and bones as
yee see that I have. Hee hath there
fore a purified body, flesh and bones
and the very same memders which
hee had when as yet his body was not
purified. And for this cause, did the
same Lorde offer to Thomas his side,
and the scarres of his five woundes,
to bee felt and handled, to the end,
that wee shoulde not doubt, but that
his very body was raysed up agayne,
Hee did both eate aud drinke with his
Disciples , as Peter in the Acts wit
nesseth before Cornelius, that al men
might knowe, that the very selfe
same body, that died, rose from death
agayne.
Now although this body bee com
prehended within a certaine lyiited
place, not dispersed all over and everie
where, although it have a just quan
tity, sigure, or shape, and a just weight
with the owne kinde and nature, yet
not withstanding it is free from every
passion, corruption and infirmitye.
For the body of the Lorde once ray
sed uppe, was in the Gardeyne, and
not in the Sepulchre, when the wo
men came to annoynt it, it meeteth
them by the waye as they returue
from the Sepulchre, and offereth it
selfe to beeseene of Magdalene in the
Gardeine : it goeth in companie to E
maus, with the two Disciples that
iourneyed to Emaus: in the meane
time while hee was with them in bo
dy, hee was not among the other Dis
ciples: when they twayne are retur
ned to the eleven, the Lord himelfe at
evening is present with them: He

Sce, for I ameven hee, to wit, cladde againe with the same body wherein I hung uppon the Crosse, For speaking yet more plainely, d prooving, that that bodie of his, was not a spirituall substaunce, hee saide: A spirite hath not fleshe and bones as yee see that I have. Hee hath there fore a purified body, flesh and bones and the very same memders which hee had when as yet his body was not purified. And for this cause, did the same Lorde offer to Thomas his side, and the scarres of his five woundes, to bee felt and handled, to the end, that wee shoulde not doubt, but that his very body was raysed up agayne, Hee did both eate aud drinke with his Disciples , as Peter in the Acts wit nesseth before Cornelius, that al men might knowe, that the very selfe same body, that died, rose from death agayne. Now although this body bee com prehended within a certaine lyiited place, not dispersed all over and everie where, although it have a just quan tity, sigure, or shape, and a just weight with the owne kinde and nature, yet not withstanding it is free from every passion, corruption and infirmitye. For the body of the Lorde once ray sed uppe, was in the Gardeyne, and not in the Sepulchre, when the wo men came to annoynt it, it meeteth them by the waye as they returue from the Sepulchre, and offereth it selfe to beeseene of Magdalene in the Gardeine : it goeth in companie to E maus, with the two Disciples that iourneyed to Emaus: in the meane time while hee was with them in bo dy, hee was not among the other Dis ciples: when they twayne are retur ned to the eleven, the Lord himelfe at evening is present with them: He
